intro: Tristania conferta var. fibrosa, commonly known as the fibrous tristania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its dense, fibrous stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
